Class Route

  • java.lang.Object
    • Route
  • public class Route
extends java.lang.Object

    Route

    The Routes are actually ordered lists of Stops and are used by Vehicles to get the next Stop.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Route​(int routeId)
      Constructor function, which also sets the number of Stops to 0.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addStop​(Stop st)
      This function adds a Stop to the end of the Stops list.
      void addVehicle​(Vehicle v)
      This function adds a vehicle to the list of Vehicles that are now on this Route.
      AllVehicles getAv()
      Getter function for av.
      int getClosestToStop​(Stop s, int[][] distances)
      This function is used to display the time until the next Vehicle will arrive in a certain stop on this Route.
      Stop getFirstStop()
      This function returns the first Stop in the Route.
      int getId()
      Getter function for the id.
      int getN()
      Getter function for n.
      Place getNextStop​(Place stop)
      This function returns the next Stop after the one that was passed.
      Stop[] getStops()
      Getter function for the list of Stops.
      void removeVehicle​(Vehicle v)
      This function removes a vehicle from the list of Vehicles that are now on this Route.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Route

        public Route​(int routeId)
        Constructor function, which also sets the number of Stops to 0.
        Parameters:
        routeId - The id of the newly created Route.

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        public int getId()
        Getter function for the id.
        Returns:
        int This is the id of the Route.

      • getStops

        public Stop[] getStops()
        Getter function for the list of Stops.
        Returns:
        Stop[] This is an array with all the Stops on the Route.

      • getN

        public int getN()
        Getter function for n.
        Returns:
        int This is the number of Stops in a Route.

      • addStop

        public void addStop​(Stop st)
        This function adds a Stop to the end of the Stops list.
        Parameters:
        st - This is the Stop to be added.

      • getFirstStop

        public Stop getFirstStop()
        This function returns the first Stop in the Route.
        Returns:
        Stop This the element on the first position in the Stops array.

      • getAv

        public AllVehicles getAv()
        Getter function for av.
        Returns:
        AllVehicles Returns the list of Vehicles that are now on this route.

      • addVehicle

        public void addVehicle​(Vehicle v)
        This function adds a vehicle to the list of Vehicles that are now on this Route.
        Parameters:
        v - The vehicle to be added.

      • removeVehicle

        public void removeVehicle​(Vehicle v)
        This function removes a vehicle from the list of Vehicles that are now on this Route.
        Parameters:
        v - The Vehicle to be removed.

      • getNextStop

        public Place getNextStop​(Place stop)
        This function returns the next Stop after the one that was passed. If the passed Stop is not in the list, it will return the first stop instead.
        Parameters:
        stop - This is the current Stop.
        Returns:
        Stop This is the next Stop.

      • getClosestToStop

        public int getClosestToStop​(Stop s,
                            int[][] distances)
        This function is used to display the time until the next Vehicle will arrive in a certain stop on this Route.
        Parameters:
        s - The stop for which we need the computation.
        distances - The matrix of distances between all the Places.
        Returns:
        int The time until the next Vehicle arrives on this line.
